Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Embodiment \Em*bod"i*ment\, n. 1. The act of embodying; the state of being embodied. [1913 Webster]
2. That which embodies or is embodied; representation in a physical body; a completely organized system, like the body; as, the embodiment of courage, or of courtesy; the embodiment of true piety. [1913 Webster]

embodiment n 1: a new personification of a familiar idea; "the embodiment of hope"; "the incarnation of evil"; "the very avatar of cunning" [syn: {incarnation}, {avatar}] 2: a concrete representation of an otherwise nebulous concept; "a circle was the embodiment of his concept of life" [syn: {shape}] 3: giving concrete form to an abstract concept
